result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha L. Chipman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $101.74 paid directly to the Clerk of Court's Office prior to sentencing.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $10.17 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
The defendant is not to issue any checks for payment; may have an account by utilizing debit card only.

Defendant is to complete a financial literacy course.   Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha L. Chipman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:40 PM: Defendant Samantha L. Chipman in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Def does not wish counsel today and is prepared to resolve matter today.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Def paid Rest in full prior to going of record.  ADA argues for 1 yr probation w/conditions.  Statement by Def:  Yes - explains attempts to pay victim prior to charging.  The Court:  45 days WCJ (GT, Huber, No TS credit) - I/S - S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:   Def is not to issue any checks for payments; may have an account by utilizing debit card only; to complete a financial literacy course; Court Costs with Rest of $101.74 PIF today - 60 DTP or PP. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.  Def states she intends to move out of State at the end of the month.  Court would consider alteratives - realizing supervision will not transfer to another state - further information will need to be known with further discussions.  Must address the issue with Supervising Agent first.  Def must complete ID process today with WCSD.
